pullRequest.title: Text Assessment V2
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
Current Text Assessment is problematic in many ways:

mapping between Text and Feedback is cumbersome and
implementation is inconsistent with e.g. assessment of modeling exercises.

Description
This PR introduces a new UI to add feedback to textblocks inline.
Tutors can hover of the precomputed Text Blocks and click to add a Feedback Element inline.
When editing a feedback element, the referencees text block is highlighted.
Steps for Testing

Log in to Artemis
Create Text Submission, make sure to use sentences with punctuation so it runs without segmentation).
Open a Text Assessment
Navigate to New Assement UI by Changing URL from /#/course-management/:exerciseId/text-exercises/:exerciseId/submissions/:submissionId/assessment
to /#/course-management/:exerciseId/text-exercises/:exerciseId/submissions-new/:submissionId/assessment
Hover over text to selet block, click to edit feedback and save/submit.

Screenshots

Future Work

Example Submissions
Complaints
Custom definitions of Text Blocks

nodes.bodyText: Does busy need to be set to false in the error case as well?
Does busy need to be set to false in the error case as well?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @deprecated Text Blocks should be returned with Submission.
          
          
            
                 * @deprecated Text Blocks should be returned with Submission. Please use V2 text assessment which does not need this API call. This API call will be removed soon.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -190,11 +209,13 @@ public TextAssessmentResource(AuthorizationCheckService authCheckService, Result
      * Splits the TextSubmission corresponding to a resultId into TextBlocks.
      * The TextBlocks get a suggested feedback if automatic assessment is enabled and feedback available
      *
+     * @deprecated Text Blocks should be returned with Submission.
